article.title: The ESO's VLT Type Ia supernova spectral set of the final two years of SNLS

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the approximate average redshift of the SNe Ia classified as SN Ia in this sample?
Which statement best describes the phase distribution of the SN Ia (dark blue) and SN Ia + SN Ia (light blue) samples?
choices: Both samples have a similar phase distribution centered around maximum light.
The SN Ia sample has a broader phase distribution than the SN Ia sample.
The SN Ia sample is concentrated at earlier phases than the SN Ia sample.
The SN Ia sample has a larger fraction of spectra with phases later than 5 days.

multiple_choice_question.text: Based on this figure, what is the typical range for SALT2 color (c) values for standard SNe Ia in this sample?
What does the similarity of the composite spectra with fgal < 50% (red) and fgal ≥ 50% (blue) suggest?
choices: The host-galaxy subtraction technique is unreliable.
There is a strong redshift evolution of SNe Ia spectral properties.
The host-galaxy subtraction technique is generally effective for most spectra.
The SN Ia sample is heavily contaminated by non-Ia objects.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Formula 1: EW(Si ii) = (−139.3 ± 10.9) × s + (150.9 ± 10.8) Å describe?
choices: The relationship between stretch and phase for SNe Ia.
The dependence of SN Ia redshift on host-galaxy stellar mass.
The correlation between stretch and the equivalent width of the Si ii λ4130 absorption feature for SNe Ia.
The evolution of SN Ia color as a function of redshift.
